official-title.#text:
To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to allow the Secretary of Education to award Early
			 College Federal Pell Grants.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Go to High School, Go to College Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Go to High School, Go to College Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 401 of the Higher Education Act of 1965

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that a student not been enrolled in an
			 elementary or secondary school to be eligible to receive a Federal Pell
			 Grant under this section, for the award years beginning on July 1, 2014,
			 and ending on June 30, 2020, the

shall carry out a program to
			 award Early College Federal Pell Grants to eligible students to support
			 enrollment in, and completion of, postsecondary courses offered through an
			 early college high school.

text.#text: Notwithstanding the requirement under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
by regulation, while enrolled in postsecondary
			 courses offered by an early college high school.

text.#text:
An eligible student may receive an Early College Federal Pell Grant under this subsection in an
			 amount equal to the cost of not more than 4 full-time postsecondary
			 semesters, or the equivalent of 4 full-time postsecondary semesters, as
			 determined by the

header.#text: Maximum period for Early College Federal Pell Grants

text.#text:
An Early College Federal Pell Grant received under this subsection shall be counted toward the
			 maximum period for which a student may receive Federal Pell Grants under
			 this section, as provided under subsection (c)(5).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may waive the requirement under subparagraph (A) on a case-by-case basis for any
			 student demonstrating evidence of a credible disruption or redirection in
			 course of study necessitating additional time to complete a postsecondary
			 degree or credential.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Counting of awards for purposes of Federal Pell Grants

text.#text:
Except as provided in this subsection, an Early College Federal Pell Grant received under this
			 subsection shall have the same terms and conditions, and be awarded in the
			 same manner, as Federal Pell Grants awarded under this section.

An eligible student may only receive an Early College Federal Pell Grant under this subsection upon
			 completion of a full-time postsecondary semester, or the equivalent of a
			 full-time postsecondary semester, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall pay an eligible institution that is engaged in a partnership as part of an
			 early college high school an amount equal to the cost of tuition, fees,
			 and books for each postsecondary course (including with respect to the
			 postsecondary courses completed to satisfy the requirement under
			 subparagraph (B)) an eligible student completes through such early college
			 high school, provided such eligible student satisfies the requirement
			 under subparagraph (B).

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on the program of
			 postsecondary courses provided to eligible students that includes the
			 following information:

text.#text: Each early college high school shall annually submit to the

Total number and percentage of eligible students who enroll in and subsequently complete the
			 program at the early college high school.

The number of postsecondary credits earned by eligible students while enrolled in the early college
			 high school that may be applied toward a postsecondary degree or
			 credential program.

The percentage of eligible students enrolled in the early college high school who concurrently earn
			 a secondary school diploma and an associate degree or equivalent.

The percentage of early college high school graduates completing the program who enroll in a
			 postsecondary institution.

The total amount of Early College Federal Pell Grants awarded to eligible students served by the
			 early college high school.
In this subsection:

that enables a student enrolled at such secondary school to simultaneously earn a secondary school
			 diploma and postsecondary credits that are transferable to such eligible
			 institution as part of an organized course of study toward a postsecondary
			 degree or credential at no cost to the student or the family of the
			 student;

that offers students enrolled at such secondary school postsecondary courses provided by an
			 eligible institution as part of a State-approved program of study that
			 leads to a postsecondary degree, certificate, or general education core
			 that is transferable to such eligible institution;

that provides such students the opportunity to earn not less than 12 credit hours in such
			 postsecondary courses; and

that provides support, placement test prep strategies, tutoring, or comparable strategies to ensure
			 student preparation for and success in college courses.

quote.#tail: means a partnership between a public secondary school and at least one eligible institution—

text.#text: The term

quote.#tail:
means a student enrolled at an early college high school who, if such student met the requirements
			 of

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for eligibility for a Federal Pell Grant, would be awarded
			 a Federal Pell Grant after the determination of the expected family
			 contribution for such student.
